required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Opportunities and Limits to Deprescribing in Nursing Homes:Quality Circle Deprescribing Module
clinical_study.official_title: Opportunities and Limits to Deprescribing in Nursing Homes:Quality Circle Deprescribing Module

brief_summary.textblock:
Older people residing in nursing homes (NH) are frequently polymedicated and often prescribed potentially inappropriate medications. Deprescribing has been proposed as a way to reduce the number of drugs they receive and their exposure to harmful treatments.
The objectives of this study are 1) To evaluate the effect of a deprescribing-specific interdisciplinary quality circle module on the use of potentially inappropriate medication in nursing-home residents. 2) To determine the effective strategies to reach and implement deprescribing consensus resulting of said quality circle module.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Potentially Inappropriate Galenic Units
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome is the percentage, at follow-up, of potentially inappropriate galenic units at follow-up, relative to the total number of galenic units used in the nursing home.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Potentially Inappropriate Defined Daily Doses (DDDs) Per Average Resident and Per Day
primary_outcome.description: Sum of Defined Daily Doses identified as potentially inappropriate (PIM, see protocol for assessement method), divided by the total number of days spent in the NH

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Potentially Inappropriate DDD to Avoid
secondary_outcome.description: Sum of Defined Daily Doses identified as "to avoid" (see protocol for assessement method), divided by the total number of days spent in the NH.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Potentially Inappropriate DDD to Reevaluate
secondary_outcome.description: Sum of Defined Daily Doses identified as "to reevaluate" (see protocol for assessement method), divided by the total number of days spent in the NH.
The number of days spent in the hospital by average resident
Number of residents of the nursing home having died during the considered year, divided by the total number of residents having stayed in the nursing home.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Falls Per Average Resident and Per Year
secondary_outcome.description: Number of falls per average resident and per year

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Residents With at Least One Day of Physical Restraints Use
secondary_outcome.description: Number of residents of the nursing home with at least one day of physical restraints use during the considered year, divided by the total number of residents having stayed in the nursing home.

arm_group.description: Nursing Homes allocated to the Intervention arm will enact the Quality Circle Deprescribing Module and create a local deprescribing consensus and implementation strategy.
Nursing Homes allocated to the Control arm will not enact the intervention.

intervention.description: The Quality Circle Deprescribing Module consist of a discussion bringing together nurses, physicians and responsible pharmacist to create a local deprescribing consensus for frequently used drug classes, as well as implementation strategies for the consensus..

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Nursing homes taking part in the study must have
- a geriatric of psycho-geriatric mission;
- been part of their cantonal pharmaceutical assistance program for at least a year.
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

group.title: Intervention
group.description: Nursing Homes allocated to the Intervention arm will enact the Quality Circle Deprescribing Module and create a local deprescribing consensus and implementation strategy. Quality Circle Deprescribing Module: The Quality Circle Deprescribing Module consist of a discussion bringing together nurses, physicians and responsible pharmacist to create a local deprescribing consensus for frequently used drug classes, as well as implementation strategies for the consensus..

group.title: Control
group.description: Nursing Homes allocated to the Control arm will not enact the intervention.

participants_list.participants: No individual participants were recruited, only nursing homes.
No individual participants were recruited, only nursing homes.
No individual participants were recruited, only nursing homes.
1 nursing home withdrew from the study. No individual participants were recruited, only nursing homes.

baseline.population: The unit of analysis for the trial is the nursing home (NH); no individual NH residents were enroled. Therefore, no data on age and gender can be provided.

group.title: Intervention
group.description: Nursing Homes allocated to the Intervention arm will enact the Quality Circle Deprescribing Module and create a local deprescribing consensus and implementation strategy. Quality Circle Deprescribing Module: The Quality Circle Deprescribing Module consist of a discussion bringing together nurses, physicians and responsible pharmacist to create a local deprescribing consensus for frequently used drug classes, as well as implementation strategies for the consensus..

group.title: Control
group.description: Nursing Homes allocated to the Control arm will not enact the intervention.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: NH mission
measure.description: Psycho-geriatric mission include NHs with mixed mission (both geriatric and psycho-geriatric)

measure.title: Number of average residents
measure.description: Total number of days spent in the nursing home (NH) by all residents in a year, divided by 365. Roughly equivalent to the number of beds in the NH, but accounting for "empty beds". NOT equivalent to the average number of residents, as this measure would require the knowledge of individual residents, which was not collected for this study. Only data at the NH level (e.g. total number of days spent in the H) were collected.

measure.title: Percentage of potentially inappropriate galenic units
measure.description: Percentage of potentially inappropriate galenic units, relative to the total number of galenic units used in the nursing home in a year.

measure.title: Overall number of potentially inappropriate DDD
measure.description: Potentially inappropriate medications are classified as "to avoid" (indicating that inappropriate use is more likely) or "to reevaluate". The overall number is the sum of these two categories.
measure.units: DDD per average resident and per day

measure.title: Number of potentially inappropriate DDD to avoid
measure.description: Potentially inappropriate medications are classified as "to avoid" (indicating that inappropriate use is more likely) or "to reevaluate".
measure.units: DDD per average resident and per day

measure.title: Number of potentially inappropriate DDD to reevaluate
measure.description: Potentially inappropriate medications are classified as "to avoid" (indicating that inappropriate use is more likely) or "to reevaluate".
measure.units: DDD per average resident and per day

measure.title: Mortality rate
measure.description: Percentage of residents in the nursing home (NH) having died in the considered year, relative to the total number of residents having stayed at the NH during this year.

measure.title: Days in hospital
measure.description: Total number of days spent in the hospital by all nursing residents in the considered year, divided by the number of average residents.

measure.title: Number of falls
measure.description: Total number of falls that occured in the nursing home during the considered year, divided by the number of average residents.
measure.units: Falls per avg. resident and per year

measure.title: Rate of physical restraints use
measure.description: Percentage of residents in the nursing home (NH) with at least one day with physical restraints during the considered year, relative to the total number of residents having stayed at the NH during this year.

outcome.title: Percentage of Potentially Inappropriate Galenic Units
outcome.description: The primary outcome is the percentage, at follow-up, of potentially inappropriate galenic units at follow-up, relative to the total number of galenic units used in the nursing home.
outcome.population: The analysis level is the nursing home; no data on individual residents were collected

analysis.method_desc: Dependant variable = follow-up value; adjusted for baseline value, canton, avg number of residents, mission

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
